alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN UNION AND EAST CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles southeast of Raton Crews Airport, or 20 miles southeast of Raton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Union and east central Colfax Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
